sourcing.instructions: La (Lanthanum): Available from chemical supply companies. P (Phosphorus): Obtain from chemical suppliers or laboratory stores. Ru (Ruthenium): Available from precious metal suppliers. Sm (Samarium): Obtain from specialized rare earth suppliers.
steps: La (Lanthanum): Available from chemical supply companies. P (Phosphorus): Obtain from chemical suppliers or laboratory stores. Ru (Ruthenium): Available from precious metal suppliers. Sm (Samarium): Obtain from specialized rare earth suppliers.

1. Weigh out 10.00 g of La, 4.00 g of P, 76.00 g of Ru, and 0.50 g of Sm using an analytical balance. 2. Combine the measured powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until a uniform powder is achieved, ensuring all components are thoroughly blended. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a ball mill for 1 hour to achieve a finer particle size and better homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 10.00 g of La, 4.00 g of P, 76.00 g of Ru, and 0.50 g of Sm using an analytical balance. 2. Combine the measured powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture until a uniform powder is achieved, ensuring all components are thoroughly blended. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a ball mill for 1 hour to achieve a finer particle size and better homogeneity.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the mixed powder into a suitable crucible made of alumina or similar material. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and hold the temperature at 1200째C for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the mixed powder into a suitable crucible made of alumina or similar material. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and hold the temperature at 1200째C for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 8-10 hours. Avoid opening the furnace during cooling to prevent rapid temperature changes.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 8-10 hours. Avoid opening the furnace during cooling to prevent rapid temperature changes.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Transfer the solidified material to a clean work surface. 3. Use a diamond saw or grinding tool to cut the material into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating if the sample will be exposed to the environment.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Transfer the solidified material to a clean work surface. 3. Use a diamond saw or grinding tool to cut the material into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating if the sample will be exposed to the environment.
